basics.name: Blake Saari
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Studying to obtain a B.B.A. in Finance, Management Information Systems, and International Business in the Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

education.area: Finance, Management Information Systems, International Business (expected Spring, 2023)

work.summary: Exceptional customer experience through high quality service
highlights: Ensured company policy, vision statement, and objectives were followed
Leveraged customer relationships to build loyalty, increase spending, and ensure return business

work.summary: Developed exceptional organizational and time management skills within a fast-paced work environment
highlights: Proven ability to demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills with staff and customers
Managed time effectively to stay on schedule and avoid burned, cold, or soiled food

volunteer.organization: Associated Students of the University of Hawaiʻi
volunteer.summary: Allocating ASUH's stock portfolio and student fees towards student activities
highlights: Facilitated the approval and payment of awards for service to members of the senate
Oversaw an investment portfolio of over $11.3 million managed by Graystone Consulting
Successfully recruited over 50 brothers (75% increase) while fostering an alumni support network
Documenting activities and reporting for university and national reports
Participated in local community service projects: Adopt a Highway, NAMIWalks, Walk to Defeat ALS, and Surfrider
